intro: Antholyza thonneri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety foliage and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually tubular with five lobes, and they come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Antholyza thonneri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
